attributes.descriptionHtml:
Hi hoomans, my name is Doli, and I'm in the prime of my life at about 11-years-old.  Everyone comments on my sky blue eyes and thick husky-type hair that is every shade of gold you can imagine. My tail is like a fox's - thick, long, and curly. At 50 lbs, I am a fit and healthy girl 


I am very chill and quiet. That doesn't mean I don't get excited because I do! When the "hoomans" come home, I do a fun little wiggle dance to welcome them! I would be a great fit for a shared wall situation (i.e., like an apartment of townhome) since I rarely bark. I LOVE being outside and like going on walks and car rides. When I am inside, I have the very "bestest "manners. I like the security of my crate, but I don't need to be locked in. I sleep in my crate, on the floor, or in the master walk-in closet that I think is my den. I wouldn't dream of chewing up anything. Well, maybe I would DREAM it but wouldn't DO it!

I am shy around new people but warm up quickly and have adjusted fine in my foster home. I am not a fan of other animals, but if I see them out, I ignore them and hope they go away! 

More of my pictures can be found here:  https://flic.kr/s/aHBqjA21ay

Hope to meet you soon! Doli

 

For inquiries, email inquiry@angelsrescue.org

An Adoption Application for this dog can be found and submitted online: http://www.angelsrescue.org/adopt/adoption-forms

Be sure to like our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/angelsrescue.
attributes.name: Doli
attributes.searchString: Doli   Fawn Female Large *  Dogs Husky / Shepherd / Mixeds
attributes.specialNeedsDetails: 8/18/23 Returned after 1-month placed on 7-day hold.   3/23/22 - aggressive toward other dog in home;UTD on vaccines

attributes.descriptionHtml:
Hi there, let me tell you a little about myself. I like nothing better than hanging with my people at home or going on walks. I walk nicely on a leash and love exploring and sniffing while out. I'm a chill girl and very well-behaved in the home. 

I do all my pottying outside, and although I don't need to be crated, and I will even hang out in my crate if you need me to. I sleep in my crate in my foster home and love to lay alongside my people on the couch. I am a gentle girl and take my treats so nicely.

I'm an 11-year-old Sharpei/Boxer mix who is very healthy and weighs around 60 lbs. I'm unsure what it means, but my foster mom always tells me how gorgeous I am.

I sound just about perfect, don't I? I like other dogs well enough and don't mind passing them when we walk, but I would be better in a home without dogs, cats and small children. I can even play in the yard with some, but I'm not particularly eager to share my space or my things with them, so I'm looking for a forever home where I'm the only dog. I should clarify that I don't mind sharing my things with people; it's just the other dogs I don't want to share with.

And cats? Well, my foster Mom says I'm way too interested in cats to be able to share a home with any.

I don't have a lot of experience with young children, so my foster mom thinks I should stick to adults and teens because I may not do well with the energy of a younger child.

Anyway, that's my story. I'd love to meet and get to know you.
 
 
 
 
See more photos of Cylana by copy and pasting this link into your browser:
https://flic.kr/s/aHBqjAYW7j
 
Apply to adopt me at www. angelsrescue.org/adopt and search for me, Cylana!

Make a donation in this dog's name at http://www.angelsrescue.org/donate. For inquiries, email inquiry@angelsrescue.org.

An Adoption Application for this dog can be found at http://www.angelsrescue.org/pet-forms/dog-adoption-app.asp and can be submitted online.

Be sure to like our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/angelsrescue.
attributes.name: Cylana
attributes.searchString: Cylana   Black with White Female Large *  Dogs Shar Pei / Boxer / Mixed (short coat)s

attributes.descriptionHtml:
Root Beer is a 13-year-old male Lab/Weimaraner, 85 lbs, mix who has a serious zest for life. Don't let his age fool you — this distinguished gentleman has the heart of an explorer and the spirit of a loyal companion. His favorite pastimes? Car rides, leisurely walks, human attention, and… relocating his dog food bowl around the house. (Yes, it’s his version of interior design.)

Whether he's trotting alongside you on a trail or cozying up for some head scratches, Root Beer knows how to make the most of every moment — and he wants to share them all with you. 

 

 

Make a donation in this dog's name at http://www.angelsrescue.org/donate. For inquiries, email inquiry@angelsrescue.org An Adoption Application for this dog can be found at and can be submitted online. http://www.angelsrescue.org/adopt/adoption-forms Be sure to like our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/angelsrescue.
attributes.name: Root Beer
attributes.searchString: Root Beer   Gray Male X-Large *  Dogs Labrador Retriever / Mixed (short coat)s

attributes.descriptionHtml:
Gunnie is a 13-year-old female Lab-Weimaraner mix with a heart as big as her soulful eyes. This sweet, silver-coated lady is in her golden years, but don’t let her age fool you — she still perks up for her favorite things: leisurely walks, windows-down car rides, tasty treats, and just about any kind of affection you’re offering.

At around 75 lbs, Gunnie is the perfect size for snuggling beside you on the couch or accompanying you on a short stroll through the neighborhood. She's friendly with humans of all kinds and would thrive in a calm home where she can soak up love and enjoy her well-earned retirement.

Gunnie is fully vetted, spayed, and house-trained. She does well with other mellow dogs and would be happy as either a solo companion or with her brother Root Beer. She doesn’t ask for much — just your time, your kindness, and a soft bed to call her own.

 

 

An Adoption Application for this dog can be found at and can be submitted online. http://www.angelsrescue.org/adopt/adoption-forms Be sure to like our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/angelsrescue.
attributes.name: Gunnie
attributes.searchString: Gunnie   Black Female Large *  Dogs Labrador Retriever / Weimaraner / Mixed (short coat)s

attributes.breedString: Labrador Retriever / Chow Chow / Mixed (medium coat)
attributes.descriptionHtml:
Meet Lucky! ✨

Lucky is a spirited sweetheart with just the right amount of spunk to keep life interesting! She loves staying active, especially when it means going for walks and soaking up all the good vibes.

Lucky has spent time in a long-term foster home, where she quickly stole their hearts—and honestly, who wouldn’t love this little love ball? She’s leash trained, knows her basic commands, and thrives both indoors and outdoors.

While Lucky would prefer to be the queen of the castle, she might get along with a calm, independent older female dog—as long as she can keep her spot as the main squeeze!

Could Lucky be the perfect fit for your home? Come meet her and see for yourself! Give the Ranch a call today to say hi to Lucky!

Read Lucky's Dog of the Week post here:  https://rrdog.org/dw/meet-lucky/

Thank you for considering adopting a Rescue Ranch dog. While they are with us, each and every rescue dog receives the best of care in a loving and nurturing environment. Their routines include daily playgroups or partnering with dog buddies, quality time walking or being groomed, and two meals a day with dog biscuits for dessert.
attributes.descriptionText:
Meet Lucky! ✨





Lucky is a spirited sweetheart with just the right amount of spunk to keep life interesting! She loves staying active, especially when it means going for walks and soaking up all the good vibes.





Lucky has spent time in a long-term foster home, where she quickly stole their hearts—and honestly, who wouldn’t love this little love ball? She’s leash trained, knows her basic commands, and thrives both indoors and outdoors.





While Lucky would prefer to be the queen of the castle, she might get along with a calm, independent older female dog—as long as she can keep her spot as the main squeeze!





Could Lucky be the perfect fit for your home? Come meet her and see for yourself! Give the Ranch a call today to say hi to Lucky!





Read Lucky's Dog of the Week post here: 

https://rrdog.org/dw/meet-lucky/


Thank you for considering adopting a Rescue Ranch dog. While they are with us, each and every rescue dog receives the best of care in a loving and nurturing environment. Their routines include daily playgroups or partnering with dog buddies, quality time walking or being groomed, and two meals a day with dog biscuits for dessert.

attributes.name: Angels Among Us Pet Rescue
attributes.adoptionProcess: Applications can be filled out at www.angelsrescue.org/adopt.  We require all pets in the home (barring medical and age exceptions) to be up to date on vaccinations and spayed/neutered.
attributes.about:
Angels Among Us Pet Rescue, Inc. is a 501(c)(3), non-profit, volunteer-based organization dedicated to rescuing dogs and cats from high-kill shelters in North Georgia. It was created in February 2009 by a group of people in the Atlanta area who wanted to do more to save the many adoptable dogs and cats who found themselves on death row in Georgia animal control facilities. Our motto is âRescue One Until There are None.â

Please visit our website at www.angelsrescue.org to view our adoptable pets or to make a donation. Track our progress and view our schedule of events on Facebook at www.facebook.com/angelsrescue and https://www.facebook.com/angelsrescue.cats . Please become a fan and tell your friends about our organization to help us save more animals!

attributes.name: Rescue Ranch
attributes.adoptionProcess: Application, Home check (can be via photos and google earth if more than 50 miles). Adoption donation $195.00 for adults, $295.00 for puppies. Includes all vaccinations, microchip, health check and spay/neuter. Discounts for Seniors, Senior dogs, military and special needs
attributes.about: We are a small non-profit, no kill rescue for dogs. we operate on donations only, volunteers and proceeds from our boarding facility.  We have had non-profit status since 2000 and opened a new facility in 2008. We have many partnerships with rescues and organizations outside the county and CA.  AND we do it for the dogs!
attributes.services: adoptions, training, spay/neuter, commumity pet food, rehome
